author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Ian Wright hits out at players for failing to respond to 'specialist in failure' dig at Arsene Wenger | Metro News

organizations.name: arsene wenger | metro news search metro follow us arsenal

text:
Search Metro Follow us Arsenal legend Ian Wright hits out at players for failing to respond to ‘specialist in failure’ dig at Arsene Wenger Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 9:10 am Arsene Wenger has been let down by his players, says Ian Wright (Picture: Getty) 
Former Arsenal star Ian Wright has hit out at this current crop of players for delivering one of the most humiliating results of Arsene Wenger ‘s career. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The Gunners crumbled at the hands of Chelsea towards the end of the 2013/14 season, losing 6-0 at Stamford Bridge on the day of Wenger’s 1000th game in charge of the club. 
Wright recalls how then-Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho had called Wenger a ‘specialist in failure’ not long before the match, and believes Arsenal’s players should have responded on the pitch. Chelsea thrashed Arsenal in Wenger’s 1000th game (Picture: Getty) 
The 53-year-old, who played for Arsenal for seven years, insists this kind of capitulation would never have happened during his time at the club. 
Speaking to Suddeutsche , Wright said: ‘You must understand: Arsene Wenger’s coaching style is quite passive. I thought it was wonderful, because I used to be called on by coaches.
